page.title:
Summary of LDCM CCA Changes in 2010
Summary of LDCM CCA Changes in 2010
page.normal_text:
U.S. Department of Interior
U.S. Department of Interior
page.enlisting:
• Minor changes to CCA Control flow. • Quality Band format has been finalized. • Creation of new ASTER dataset for thermal studies. – 15 ASTER scenes as both L1 (TOA reflectance) and L2 (kinetic • Addition of Thermal ACCA. – Using L7 ACCA on TIRS band 1. – Study using ASTER data suggests that surface temperature will offer no • Addition of Cirrus CCA. – Using 1.38 µm band threshold test from MODIS. • Minor changes to CCA Control flow.
• Minor changes to CCA Control flow.
• Quality Band format has been finalized.
• Quality Band format has been finalized.
• Creation of new ASTER dataset for thermal studies.
• Creation of new ASTER dataset for thermal studies.

page.title:
LDCM ACCA
LDCM ACCA
page.normal_text:
The LDCM ACCA algorithm is only the classification phase of ACCA, using TIRS thermal band 1.
The LDCM ACCA algorithm is only the
classification phase of ACCA, using
TIRS thermal band 1.

The snow/ice and water classifications reported by the ACCA algorithm will be provided in the Quality Band of the L1 product.
The snow/ice and water classifications
reported by the ACCA algorithm will be
provided in the Quality Band of the L1
product.

U.S. Department of Interior
U.S. Department of Interior

picture.caption: ACCA is a simple decision tree that does crude classification of land cover and clouds, then refines the cloud estimates using statistical data from the thermal band. It was developed by NASA Goddard for the Landsat program.
picture.name: combined_0

page.title:
AT-ACCA
AT-ACCA
page.normal_text:
AT-ACCA is a variant of the ACCA algorithm that uses an 'artificial thermal' or AT band. This was developed as a means of running ACCA when thermal data is not available.
AT-ACCA is a variant of the ACCA algorithm that uses an 'artificial thermal' or AT band.
This was developed as a means of running ACCA when thermal data is not available.

To reduce the number of pixels markes as 'ambiguous' by the ACCA algorithm, a disambiguation algorithm was added to AT-ACCA. This is a small McCulloch-Pitts neural network organized in a voting scheme that can re-designate ambiguous pixels as either cloudy or clear terrain.
To reduce the number of pixels markes as 'ambiguous' by the ACCA algorithm, a
disambiguation algorithm was added to AT-ACCA. This is a small McCulloch-Pitts neural
network organized in a voting scheme that can re-designate ambiguous pixels as either
cloudy or clear terrain.

L7 Band 6
L7 Band 6

AT band
AT band

U.S. Department of Interior
U.S. Department of Interior

picture.caption: The AT band formula was created using the Rulequest Cubist statistical modelling software as a combination of the reflective bands (Landsat bands 1-5 & 7). It was trained on 2 million pixels randomly selected from 103 Landsat 7 scenes, and it has an RMS Average Difference from actual Band 6 brightness temperature of 9.5 K.
picture.name: combined_0

page.title:
See5 CCA
See5 CCA
page.normal_text:
Once the dataset is divided into subsets, C5.0 then iterates over the subsets. It may select a different variable for each iteration. The user specifies how many iterations and what minimal amount of data each branch must contain. The end result is a decision tree of user-specified size.
Once the dataset is divided into subsets, C5.0
then iterates over the subsets. It may select a
different variable for each iteration. The user
specifies how many iterations and what minimal
amount of data each branch must contain. The
end result is a decision tree of user-specified size.

The LDCM See5 CCA decision tree has 245 branches, and was trained using 6.4 million pixels randomly selected from 104 Landsat 7 scenes.
The LDCM See5 CCA decision tree has 245
branches, and was trained using 6.4 million pixels
randomly selected from 104 Landsat 7 scenes.

picture.caption: The See5 CCA algorithm was created using the Rulequest C5.0 stastical classifier software. The Rulequest C5.0 software creates a decision tree by finding the input variable which can best be divided by a threshold test. It selects the threshold value that minimizes the entropy in the dataset. . . . . . . . . . . . . U.S. Department of Interior
picture.name: combined_0

page.title:
Cloud Datasets
Cloud Datasets
page.normal_text:
U.S. Department of Interior
U.S. Department of Interior
page.enlisting:
'Irish' Dataset – 212 Landsat 7 L1Gs scenes. (207 used) – Manual truth masks created by three analysts. – For general cloud studies. – Available online. • Hyperion Dataset – 22 Hyperion scenes, spectrally resampled to resemble Landsat 7 bands 1-5 & 7. – Manual truth masks created by a single analyst. – For studying Cirrus algorithms. • ASTER Dataset – 15 ASTER scenes as both L1 (TOA reflectance) and L2 (kinetic temperature). – Manual truth masks created by a single analyst. – For studying brightness temperature / surface temperature differences in ACCA. 'Irish' Dataset – 212 Landsat 7 L1Gs scenes. (207 used) – Manual truth masks created by three analysts. – For general cloud studies. – Available online.
'Irish' Dataset
– 212 Landsat 7 L1Gs scenes. (207 used)
– Manual truth masks created by three analysts.
– For general cloud studies.
– Available online.

– 15 ASTER scenes as both L1 (TOA reflectance) and L2 (kinetic temperature). – Manual truth masks created by a single analyst. – For studying brightness temperature / surface temperature differences in ACCA.

page.title:
Goddard / Rich Irish Test Data Set
Goddard / Rich Irish Test Data Set
page.normal_text:
U.S. Department of Interior
U.S. Department of Interior
page.enlisting:
• – Provided by Rich Irish at NASA Goddard. – Divided by latitude into 9 zones, 20-24 scenes per zone. – Scenes acquired in 2000-2001. – When referring to 'Irish' in this presentation, we are referring to this data • – – Manual masks were created by three operators at EDC. – Cloud masks should be treated as having ~7% error. • – Scenes were tagged based on scene content and ACCA performance. – – Division into training and validation sets was performed while attempting to equalize the quantity of each tag in each • – Courtesy of EDC. Contact pscar@usgs.gov for instructions. 212 Landsat 7 L1Gs scenes 207 scenes with manual cloud masks 5 scenes were excluded due to visible gain change artifacts. 104 Training scenes, 103 Validation scenes. • One scene had a gain change but no visible artifacts; it was retained. • Based on 11 masks duplicated by all three operators. • – Provided by Rich Irish at NASA Goddard. – Divided by latitude into 9 zones, 20-24 scenes per zone. – Scenes acquired in 2000-2001. – When referring to 'Irish' in this presentation, we are referring to this data • – – Manual masks were created by three operators at EDC. – Cloud masks should be treated as having ~7% error. • – Scenes were tagged based on scene content and ACCA performance. – – Division into training and validation sets was performed while attempting to equalize the quantity of each tag in each • – Courtesy of EDC.
